commit_message:
Add multiple image support to upload_cirros noop

In I3f0f6da32134a4a15f2c4764c5334bb8e85309c8 we added support for
multiple image uploads as part of the upload_cirros task. The noop
tests were not updated with a similar support, this fixes the
noop tests to correctly support multiple images.

Change-Id: I6f8729de293a2af8b456916b9a6f8a2a32b35741
Closes-Bug: #1612145

subject: Move all lbaas to v2
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-25 13:01:54.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/neutron.pp', 'fixtures/scenario001.pp', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Move all lbaas to v2

Upstream has just removed lbaasv1 from openstack-lbaas
(https://review.openstack.org/286381). A full fix will involve
removing all lbaasv1 support from puppet-neutron, but while it is
done we should only use lbaasv2 in puppet-openstack-integration
to avoid CI issues.

Change-Id: If63110644d441bb8b088c93aebc02356b158aebd
'}]
commit_message:
Move all lbaas to v2

Upstream has just removed lbaasv1 from openstack-lbaas
(https://review.openstack.org/286381). A full fix will involve
removing all lbaasv1 support from puppet-neutron, but while it is
done we should only use lbaasv2 in puppet-openstack-integration
to avoid CI issues.

Change-Id: If63110644d441bb8b088c93aebc02356b158aebd

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-25 18:56:57.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': 'Bump ubuntu-(trusty|xenial) to 20 min-ready

With over 1.199k nodes available to use. Lets up both trusty and
xenail to 20 again.  This is the first time xenail will be 20, however
ubuntu-trust was decreased in:

  I4215296836b7ec3781cddd80fd2ae224063541d6

so this is a partial revert. Once we fully migrate devstack jobs to
xenial, I believe we could drop trusty down again.

Change-Id: I41876e5850dc96914437dbb068212fdd9eeff550
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Bump ubuntu-(trusty|xenial) to 20 min-ready

With over 1.199k nodes available to use. Lets up both trusty and
xenail to 20 again.  This is the first time xenail will be 20, however
ubuntu-trust was decreased in:

  I4215296836b7ec3781cddd80fd2ae224063541d6

so this is a partial revert. Once we fully migrate devstack jobs to
xenial, I believe we could drop trusty down again.

Change-Id: I41876e5850dc96914437dbb068212fdd9eeff550
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add retry to container start/stop handlers

Adding a retry to the container start/stop handlers will allow a restart
to be attempted more than once in the event the system isn't ready for
some reason.

Change-Id: Ie1dabf9a3b513b732025201ad3b0af593c4832dd
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix CLI auth user interface
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-25 08:51:41.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkittyclient/client.py', 'cloudkittyclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix CLI auth user interface

This patch fixes how auth options are checked in CLI.

Use either:
- tenant-id or tenant-name
- project-id and user-domain (id or name)
- project-name and project-domain (id or name) and user-domain (id or name)

For consistency, the same checking is used in the client authentication plugin.

Change-Id: I2210d8bf21bba5d1faf72dfbe38756078d8bc0c1
Closes-Bug: #1616468
'}]
commit_message:
Fix CLI auth user interface

This patch fixes how auth options are checked in CLI.

Use either:
- tenant-id or tenant-name
- project-id and user-domain (id or name)
- project-name and project-domain (id or name) and user-domain (id or name)

For consistency, the same checking is used in the client authentication plugin.

Change-Id: I2210d8bf21bba5d1faf72dfbe38756078d8bc0c1
Closes-Bug: #1616468

A new way of using vendordata plugins was introduced recently. So
this adds support for the parameters that it requires.

subject: Fix DNS zone serial number retrieval
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-25 10:42:57.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/utils/dns/test_dnsutils.py', 'os_win/utils/dns/dnsutils.py'], 'message': 'Fix DNS zone serial number retrieval

In case of secondary DNS zones, the serial number
is not available until the zone completes a DNS transfer
from the master.

This patch addresses this issue by adding an extra check to
make sure the Microsoft_SOAType object exists before trying
to access it.

Change-Id: Id006a0aac6d0772b60c51d3a458a7b35aefe8dd3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix DNS zone serial number retrieval

In case of secondary DNS zones, the serial number
is not available until the zone completes a DNS transfer
from the master.

This patch addresses this issue by adding an extra check to
make sure the Microsoft_SOAType object exists before trying
to access it.

Change-Id: Id006a0aac6d0772b60c51d3a458a7b35aefe8dd3

subject: Policy support for Trove
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-24 15:17:49.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/trove_policy_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/policy-file-support-06db0c1ae60284a5.yaml', 'manifests/policy.pp'], 'message': "Policy support for Trove

Trove is adding policy support, since it's not yet released (landing in
Newton) this code will not auto-include the policy class as other
modules do. That will be done later after all distros support a Trove
version with a policy.json file.

Change-Id: Iae8f8bf341ae17190676c524444600e660420e46
"}]
commit_message:
Policy support for Trove

Trove is adding policy support, since it's not yet released (landing in
Newton) this code will not auto-include the policy class as other
modules do. That will be done later after all distros support a Trove
version with a policy.json file.

Change-Id: Iae8f8bf341ae17190676c524444600e660420e46

commit_message:
Revert "Increase rh1 max-servers to 75"

Because of issues attaching FIPs with shade, decrease back to 50. This
should let tripleo-test-cloud-rh1 limp along until we restart
nodepool.

This reverts commit fc54caa39e715afd5730e84b13f3a8c09b36136f.

Change-Id: I9e2bcf899546befd8c7613867a8169d63201902c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Fix intermittent integration test failures related to messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-25 10:45:34.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/regions/messages.py'], 'message': "Fix intermittent integration test failures related to messages

Some recent changes in python selenium bindings library made it do
certain things faster. That rendered our code for accessing Horizon
messages too restrictive, since it didn't wait a second. Previously,
when selenium queries took longer, the modal message had enough time
to appear, but now sometimes selenium is able to query the browser
during a narrow window when the spinner from a previous modal have
already disappeared, but the modal message still hasn't been
rendered. Adapt to these change by introducing a small (0.1 seconds)
margin to wait until message element appears.

Change-Id: I8f23ecaac9d007a1d3302eb9425d4064f438ca14
"}]
commit_message:
Fix intermittent integration test failures related to messages

Some recent changes in python selenium bindings library made it do
certain things faster. That rendered our code for accessing Horizon
messages too restrictive, since it didn't wait a second. Previously,
when selenium queries took longer, the modal message had enough time
to appear, but now sometimes selenium is able to query the browser
during a narrow window when the spinner from a previous modal have
already disappeared, but the modal message still hasn't been
rendered. Adapt to these change by introducing a small (0.1 seconds)
margin to wait until message element appears.

Change-Id: I8f23ecaac9d007a1d3302eb9425d4064f438ca14

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-16 14:23:36.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_create_volume_flow.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/manager/create_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/scheduler/flows/create_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/api/create_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/common.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Use original volume OVO instance in create flow

Current manager flow for creating a volume uses the volume's id as input
instead of the volume OVO instance that we already have.

This patch changes this and uses the volume OVO for the whole flow which
has the benefit of having a consistent/updated instance once the flow
has finished.

Having the original instance updated is important because our workers
decorator for the HA A-A cleanup mechanism relies on the status of the
resources so they need to be properly updated.  Before this patch the
status from the volume OVO would remain in 'creating' regardless of the
result of the operation.

Change-Id: I7f45a151675ad976ca96f4de0cc34f19a31912f2
"}]
commit_message:
Use original volume OVO instance in create flow

Current manager flow for creating a volume uses the volume's id as input
instead of the volume OVO instance that we already have.

This patch changes this and uses the volume OVO for the whole flow which
has the benefit of having a consistent/updated instance once the flow
has finished.

Having the original instance updated is important because our workers
decorator for the HA A-A cleanup mechanism relies on the status of the
resources so they need to be properly updated.  Before this patch the
status from the volume OVO would remain in 'creating' regardless of the
result of the operation.

Change-Id: I7f45a151675ad976ca96f4de0cc34f19a31912f2

psutil.NUM_CPUS has been deprecated in psutil 2.x
While currently global-requirements restrict usage of psutil to
versions <2.0.0 it can be good to be prepared for upgrade in advance.

commit_message:
Use multiprocessing.cpu_count instead of psutil.NUM_CPUS

psutil.NUM_CPUS has been deprecated in psutil 2.x
While currently global-requirements restrict usage of psutil to
versions <2.0.0 it can be good to be prepared for upgrade in advance.
This commit makes use of multiprocessing module instead.

Change-Id: I6a4653eb7e5c26c3068a4d766acb4bc219920f75
Closes-Bug: #1598208

commit_message:
rt: isolate report and query sched client tests

Prep for future patches that start to add placement API calls to the
scheduler "reporting" client. We simply move the unit tests of the query
and reporting clients into a new nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/
directory.

subject: Change default for FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE to False
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 20:13:22.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': 'Change default for FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE to False

devstack defaults always run the metadata server and have access to
config drive. Devstack, however, supports an override so that guests
never access the metadata server. Tempest tests already do specific
config drive tests, so changing to this default lets us test both.

Change-Id: I141bb7a44b5c34620479dd56496b21e0d95d9937
'}]
commit_message:
Change default for FORCE_CONFIG_DRIVE to False

devstack defaults always run the metadata server and have access to
config drive. Devstack, however, supports an override so that guests
never access the metadata server. Tempest tests already do specific
config drive tests, so changing to this default lets us test both.

commit_message:
Fix help message for external_network_bridge

Patch [1] removed the deprecation of the external_network_bridge
config option. This fix cleans up the help message.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/305693

Change-Id: Ied206eb90939ffeff2253e5ef0fe3fb55761a0b1
Closes-Bug: #1563070

subject: neutron-lbaas - LBaas v2 Pool creation from Heat fault with lb_method attribute not present
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9828, 'name': 'Radware CI', 'email': 'openstack3rdpartytesting@radware.com', 'username': 'radware3rdpartytesting', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10980, 'name': 'Doug Wiegley', 'email': 'dougwig@parkside.io', 'username': 'dougw'}, {'_account_id': 12040, 'name': 'A10 Networks CI', 'email': 'a10-openstack-ci@a10networks.com', 'username': 'a10networks-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21614, 'name': 'JingLiu', 'email': 'liu.jing5@zte.com.cn', 'username': 'JingLiu'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-11 06:03:11.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/plugin.py'], 'message': 'neutron-lbaas - LBaas v2 Pool creation from Heat fault with lb_method attribute not present

The removed check caused a lbaas v2 pool creation invoked from heat to fail beacuse it didnt include the lb_method attribute, in lbaasv2 lb_method was not used
anymore in favor of lb_algorithm so this check would always fail

Change-Id: I50986ac2501b41e6541630484116d37876df8c82
Closes-bug: #1600675
'}]
commit_message:
neutron-lbaas - LBaas v2 Pool creation from Heat fault with lb_method attribute not present

The removed check caused a lbaas v2 pool creation invoked from heat to fail beacuse it didnt include the lb_method attribute, in lbaasv2 lb_method was not used
anymore in favor of lb_algorithm so this check would always fail

Change-Id: I50986ac2501b41e6541630484116d37876df8c82
Closes-bug: #1600675

commit_message:
Fix L7 Policy creation with Octavia driver

The L7 Policy create method is sending the listener_id to Octavia
as a POST parameter, when the Octavia is not expecting it. This is
breaking L7 Policy creation with Octavia.

Change-Id: I8fabeee79cfc70da09b50cd2da6ec16f2742d824
Closes-Bug: #1607758

commit_message:
Expose Quota.update API

There exists a method in the management API to change the quota
for a given resource.  This change exposes that API via a new
"trove quota-update" command.  Also, adds v1.Quotas to the python
client.

Note that this command requires admin privileges.

Partial implements: blueprint bp/quota-management
Change-Id: I6ca1a87fbc46781f83bc9b7bd33745783b8aaab1

commit_message:
Add connector for GPFS volumes

The Cinder backup manager now uses initiator connectors for
creating and restoring backups for all volume backends, so
this patch adds a connector for GPFS volumes to fix the
backup-create & backup-restore for the GPFS driver.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I49cc52d6df5d0c1b470ced531075d851aa30208d
Implements: blueprint os-brick-gpfs-protocol-support

subject: Decouple EndpointMap from SSL certificate params
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-12 15:26:35.000000000', 'files': ['environments/tls-endpoints-public-ip.yaml', 'environments/tls-endpoints-public-dns.yaml', 'environments/enable-tls.yaml'], 'message': "Decouple EndpointMap from SSL certificate params

Having the endpoint map in the same environment as the SSL
certificate parameters means that every time a service is added to
the overcloud, the user must remember to update their copy of
enable-tls.yaml to reflect the new service.

To avoid this, let's separate the SSL EndpointMap from the SSL
certificates so users can simply pass the shipped list of SSL
endpoints and only have to customize the certificate env file. As
and added bonus, this means they won't have to put the certificates
in enable-tls.yaml specifically.  The parameters can be set
anywhere, and will be used as long as one of the tls-endpoints
envs is also specified.

inject-trust-anchor.yaml is not changed, but it could already be
used in the same fashion.  The root certificate param could be set
in any env passed after inject-trust-anchor.yaml, and then
inject-trust-anchor.yaml would only be responsible for setting the
appropriate resource_registry entry.  This way there is no need to
customize the in-tree inject-trust-anchor.yaml either.

Change-Id: I38eabb903b8382e6577ccc97e21fbb9d09c382b3
"}]
commit_message:
Decouple EndpointMap from SSL certificate params

Having the endpoint map in the same environment as the SSL
certificate parameters means that every time a service is added to
the overcloud, the user must remember to update their copy of
enable-tls.yaml to reflect the new service.

To avoid this, let's separate the SSL EndpointMap from the SSL
certificates so users can simply pass the shipped list of SSL
endpoints and only have to customize the certificate env file. As
and added bonus, this means they won't have to put the certificates
in enable-tls.yaml specifically.  The parameters can be set
anywhere, and will be used as long as one of the tls-endpoints
envs is also specified.

inject-trust-anchor.yaml is not changed, but it could already be
used in the same fashion.  The root certificate param could be set
in any env passed after inject-trust-anchor.yaml, and then
inject-trust-anchor.yaml would only be responsible for setting the
appropriate resource_registry entry.  This way there is no need to
customize the in-tree inject-trust-anchor.yaml either.

Change-Id: I38eabb903b8382e6577ccc97e21fbb9d09c382b3

commit_message:
Get auth opts from appropriate getter

keystonemiddleware team has moved the calculation of auth opts from
keystonemiddleware.opts to keystonemiddleware.auth_token [1], so that we can
no longer access it directly, we should do it by the appropriate getter.
Conform to it.

[1] If67d8bdb68a5ab9c07b960ad0111e2310ad82c83

Change-Id: I17afd43998ef61279f3f133cc8d6a7e0d6d1324b

commit_message:
Fix the neutron-port resource with binding options

Parameters of type dict must be at the end of the
shell command to not cause conflict with the network name

This is submitted as a patch and not as a cherry-pick from
master because that's not possible since the code is not
exactly the same for the 2 branches, on MASTER the command(neutron)
is defined at the "neutron" top scope provider and on stable/mitaka
it is defined on each type

Change-Id: I2aff4a556c940cf2515447373ad80874acd693f6

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-11 17:57:32.000000000', 'files': ['syntribos/runner.py', 'syntribos/config.py'], 'message': "Adding  default config loading schema

Syntribos presently uses oslo_config's loading schema
for default config file, changing this to be in line with
our approach, where in the tool will search for config file
in the .syntribos directory in ~ , and then in local.

Change-Id: Ib3a98372a42854ed674225cd6f2ec21a8347682b
"}]
commit_message:
Adding  default config loading schema

Syntribos presently uses oslo_config's loading schema
for default config file, changing this to be in line with
our approach, where in the tool will search for config file
in the .syntribos directory in ~ , and then in local.

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-07-28 13:29:21.000000000', 'files': ['freezer/common/config.py', 'freezer/job.py', 'freezer/openstack/restore.py'], 'message': 'Fix restore nova for multiple networks

When we restore nova, if networks is multiple, it need to
modify the network-id.
if you have a network only, this parameter is not a must.
Add the following parameters to fixed the network.

nova_restore_network

usage:

    freezer-agent --action restore --nova-inst-id 111111 --nova-restore-network NETWORK_ID\
--restore-from-date 2016-07-22T08:00:00

    NETWORK_ID  the ID of network for restore nova.

Change-Id: I97dcbe360bb204131d71ecd642fbc27e743f8186
Closes-Bug: #1578078
Implements blueprint: restore-nova-nic
'}]
commit_message:
Fix restore nova for multiple networks

When we restore nova, if networks is multiple, it need to
modify the network-id.
if you have a network only, this parameter is not a must.
Add the following parameters to fixed the network.

nova_restore_network

usage:

    freezer-agent --action restore --nova-inst-id 111111 --nova-restore-network NETWORK_ID\
--restore-from-date 2016-07-22T08:00:00

    NETWORK_ID  the ID of network for restore nova.

Change-Id: I97dcbe360bb204131d71ecd642fbc27e743f8186
Closes-Bug: #1578078
Implements blueprint: restore-nova-nic

commit_message:
Fixed the use of --insecure cli option

Fixed freezer-agent to make the correct use of --insecure cli opt.
So now freezer-agent will check OS_INSECURE if not available will
look for --insecure cli opt.
Also had to fixture freezer config opts to  Allows overriding
configuration settings for the test. So added FreezerBaseTestCase
as a Base Testcase for most of tests.


Change-Id: I4a293322c79240ff5da7b238e5f5a08594788c7e
Closes-Bug: #1614139

subject: Increase jessie min-ready to 5
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-22 20:20:33.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': "Increase jessie min-ready to 5

Because packages need to build 3 times for a patch to go through,
it is still very painful to wait until provisioning is done, and
we can have the result of the check of a CR. So, I'm kindly
asking to increase from 3 to 5, which should be enough this time.

Change-Id: Ibd0f95a378187b4cddd122e9c3513148288dbbe6
"}]
commit_message:
Increase jessie min-ready to 5

Because packages need to build 3 times for a patch to go through,
it is still very painful to wait until provisioning is done, and
we can have the result of the check of a CR. So, I'm kindly
asking to increase from 3 to 5, which should be enough this time.

Change-Id: Ibd0f95a378187b4cddd122e9c3513148288dbbe6

commit_message:
Adds our repo key before apt-get update

It's looking like everything is now broken with apt-get update
failing without the key. This patch adds the key with apt-key
before adding our new repo.

Change-Id: Ia0a7269111810683d04e2a2e6d499fbfb4548832

VIM 7.4.1868 got confused and everything appeared to be in a quote

 host_ip_iface=${host_ip_iface:-$(ip -f $af route | awk '/default/ {print $5}' | head -1)}

Break it up into two lines to fix the issue.

Change-Id: If76f0533d997e3fc0c96b3993fb2f203c9f22e98
"}]
commit_message:
Try not to confuse VIM's syntax highlighting

VIM 7.4.1868 got confused and everything appeared to be in a quote
after the line:
 host_ip_iface=${host_ip_iface:-$(ip -f $af route | awk '/default/ {print $5}' | head -1)}

Break it up into two lines to fix the issue.

Change-Id: If76f0533d997e3fc0c96b3993fb2f203c9f22e98

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-11 07:18:44.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/controller/worker/tasks/database_tasks.py'], 'message': "Fixed UnmappedInstanceError thrown when  LB delete

During loadbalancer delete in certain corner case where
Amphora agent never reports the heartbeat to the octavia controller.
After load balancer creation the health manager updates the health status of
amphora in the amphora_health table . Since none of the heartbeat received
from the amphora agent and hence no entry is created in 'amphora_health'
table And eventually it goes PENDING_DELETE during delete .

This fix handles UnmappedInstanceError when there is no entries represented
in the octavia DB for the amphora health.

Change-Id: Ib149c7c93ae2f0ad97b09cbcb5668a8872f01879
Closes-Bug: #1609235
(cherry picked from commit 5891b5a0b9f386573b6e2e3364a689625f476ab9)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed UnmappedInstanceError thrown when  LB delete

During loadbalancer delete in certain corner case where
Amphora agent never reports the heartbeat to the octavia controller.
After load balancer creation the health manager updates the health status of
amphora in the amphora_health table . Since none of the heartbeat received
from the amphora agent and hence no entry is created in 'amphora_health'
table And eventually it goes PENDING_DELETE during delete .

This fix handles UnmappedInstanceError when there is no entries represented
in the octavia DB for the amphora health.

Change-Id: Ib149c7c93ae2f0ad97b09cbcb5668a8872f01879
Closes-Bug: #1609235
(cherry picked from commit 5891b5a0b9f386573b6e2e3364a689625f476ab9)

commit_message:
Fix unreachable TimeOutException bug in amphora driver

Faulty logic in the amphora REST API driver prevented a TimeOutException from being thrown when appropriate.
This commit fixes this bug and adds a unit test to ensure proper behavior.

Closes-Bug: 1583558

Change-Id: I8b8ddbf8ac93c51ad15b4c5d107138913be25bbf
(cherry picked from commit 8474c60e85114a2df87658afb440b868c3eaecbc)

commit_message:
Fix get_disabled_quotas

Disabled quotas should be treated as a set, not as a list, or else
instead of action buttons we'll get a traceback:

File "/manila-ui/manila_ui/dashboards/project/shares/__init__.py",
    line 129, in get_disabled_quotas
    disabled_quotas.extend(_get_manila_disabled_quotas(request))
AttributeError: 'set' object has no attribute 'extend'

Change-Id: I5364a8b7fbea3f166264c33ffb6eff341e140bdf
Closes-Bug: #1611368

commit_message:
add access_key to access_list API's response

Expose access credentials/keys returned by storage
backends (e.g. Ceph) with an internal authentication
system for client identities that are granted share
access.

Partially implements bp auth-access-keys
Depends-On: I486064f117cf3001dba7735ca92a7d89aee3ce5b
Change-Id: I312dd311fcee74a7c62bfc62823e5e3cbf2371ec

Ironic falls back to keystone_authtoken options when trying to access
other services, if specific options are not provided. We are not providing
the specific options yet, so bring back the fallback options removed
in commit eef5b11679e1c0e96a782f51f5e0c8aa6abfb3bd.

This is a temporary measure to unbreak users, next we should support

Change-Id: I50794f13ac7593f4a0e47f71a15c2e11ec9b2ca1
Closes-Bug: #1616873
'}]
commit_message:
Set fallback authentication options for Ironic

Ironic falls back to keystone_authtoken options when trying to access
other services, if specific options are not provided. We are not providing
the specific options yet, so bring back the fallback options removed
in commit eef5b11679e1c0e96a782f51f5e0c8aa6abfb3bd.

This is a temporary measure to unbreak users, next we should support
configuring all necessary credentials for real.

Change-Id: I50794f13ac7593f4a0e47f71a15c2e11ec9b2ca1
Closes-Bug: #1616873

commit_message:
Add name spaces initializing interface driver

This driver enables interfaces with a namespace context, which is required for
among others DNSMasq to work correctly, without attaching them to a device.
It is intended to be used with non agent based devices (e.g. VPP) that
will attach to the interface created using other means.

--

Cherry-picked from Ieab92bde48742d6e174017c56d29adde9533538a

Closes-Bug: #1602798

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-08-11 13:30:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/placement_migrations/migrate_repo/migrate.cfg', 'nova/cmd/manage.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api_models.py', 'nova/conf/database.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/placement_migrations/__init__.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/placement_migrations/migrate_repo/__init__.py', 'nova/objects/resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/fixtures.py', 'releasenotes/notes/placement-database-5aa94ece29eab820.yaml', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py', 'nova/test.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/test_resource_provider.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/placement_migrations/migrate_repo/versions/__init__.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/placement_migrations/migrate_repo/versions/001_initial.py'], 'message': "Optional separate database for placement API

If 'connection' is set in the 'placement_database' conf group use
that as the connection URL for the placement database. Otherwise if
it is None, the default, then use the entire api_database conf group
to configure a database connection.

This works by:

* adding a 'placement sync' and 'placement version' command to
  nova-manage

* adding placement_migrations that that sync will run

* adding a placement_database config group with the relevant
  database configuration settings

* adding a placement_context_manager. If
  CONF.placement_database.connection is None this is the same as
  the api_context_manager, otherwise it is a new one from its own config

* adjust nova/tests/fixtures to be aware of a 'placement' database
  and the placement_context_manager

This version of this change differs from others by not requiring
separate placement commands for migration, instead using existing
tooling, which makes the size of the change a bit smaller and also
addresses problems with the test fixtures needing to be too aware of
what migration code to run. Now it runs the same code.

This functionality is being provided to allow deployers to choose
between establishing a new database now or requiring a migration
later. The default is migration later.

This is a modification of Id93cb93a0f4e8667c8e7848aa8cff1d994c2c364
and I3290e26d0a212911f8ef386418b9fa08c685380b.

Change-Id: Ice03144376c9868c064e4393d531510615fc6fc1
Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
"}]
commit_message:
Optional separate database for placement API

If 'connection' is set in the 'placement_database' conf group use
that as the connection URL for the placement database. Otherwise if
it is None, the default, then use the entire api_database conf group
to configure a database connection.

This works by:

* adding a 'placement sync' and 'placement version' command to
  nova-manage

* adding placement_migrations that that sync will run

* adding a placement_database config group with the relevant
  database configuration settings

* adding a placement_context_manager. If
  CONF.placement_database.connection is None this is the same as
  the api_context_manager, otherwise it is a new one from its own config

* adjust nova/tests/fixtures to be aware of a 'placement' database
  and the placement_context_manager

This version of this change differs from others by not requiring
separate placement commands for migration, instead using existing
tooling, which makes the size of the change a bit smaller and also
addresses problems with the test fixtures needing to be too aware of
what migration code to run. Now it runs the same code.

This functionality is being provided to allow deployers to choose
between establishing a new database now or requiring a migration
later. The default is migration later.

This is a modification of Id93cb93a0f4e8667c8e7848aa8cff1d994c2c364
and I3290e26d0a212911f8ef386418b9fa08c685380b.

Change-Id: Ice03144376c9868c064e4393d531510615fc6fc1
Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

Puppet4 support: use dig44 function

Replace "dig" with "dig44" because of the conflict with
builtin "dig" function of Puppet4.5+

Change-Id: I9efbc956f8230f920a52944432875d4a6338f42b
Related-Bug: 1586480

commit_message:
Fix unreachable TimeOutException bug in amphora driver

Faulty logic in the amphora REST API driver prevented a TimeOutException from being thrown when appropriate.
This commit fixes this bug and adds a unit test to ensure proper behavior.

Closes-Bug: 1583558

Change-Id: I8b8ddbf8ac93c51ad15b4c5d107138913be25bbf
(cherry picked from commit 8474c60e85114a2df87658afb440b868c3eaecbc)

commit_message:
Updates certificate CLI to use cluster

Updates commands to the CA CLI to use cluster in addition to to bay.
Adds tests for cluster commands.
Currently checks for required arguments in logic instead of through
cliutils.py. Changes to cliutils.py seem to be necessary to allow
for "either-or" required arguments.
Depends on change #354436.

Change-Id: Id8c72151661514c3a80ae9fd64369b00a5b78cc9
Implements: blueprint rename-bay-to-cluster

commit_message:
Support for multi-regional apps was added

Now all OpenStack resource classes inherit CloudResource
that provides getRegion method and regionName property.
This allows to assign resources to different regions.
getRegion() returns CloudRegion instance that resource or it
parent belong to. CloudRegion has the similar interface to
Environment class and is the correct way to get HeatStack
instance associated with the regoin, default network
configuration, security group manager and agent listener
instances. Environment acts as the default region so backward
compatibility is not broken. However new applications
should not use environment to set security group rules but
rather a region(s) of their instance(s) in order to work correctly
when their instances were configured to use region other then
the default.

Change-Id: I4dbf40c65042e9a354f3bfadfcd63a63e6e3e418

subject: Adds more replica provider primitives
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-23 16:26:49.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano.applications/Classes/servers.yaml', 'meta/io.murano.applications/Classes/tests/TestReplication.yaml', 'meta/io.murano.applications/manifest.yaml', 'meta/io.murano.applications/Classes/replication.yaml'], 'message': 'Adds more replica provider primitives

This commit introduces several basic building blocks
for replication providers:

* PoolReplicaProvider returns replica from the prepopulated pool (that
  can become empty over time). Released replicas are returned to the pool.

* RoundrobinReplicaProvider returns items from the prepopulated
  list. When the list is exhausted it returns them again thus reusing
  the items. This is usually needed to spread the load between
  fixed number of servers or other cloud resources.

 * CompositeReplicaProvider allows to combine several replica
   providers into one. When new replica is requested it tries to
   obtain it from the underlay providers one by so if the first
   replica provider goes out of resources the second is used
   for further allocations.

 Also refactor replica release interface to better handle
 down-scaling by more than 1 item

Change-Id: I923b2c6d0cd3a881be323399b7b13481e9a4a459
'}]
commit_message:
Adds more replica provider primitives

This commit introduces several basic building blocks
for replication providers:

* PoolReplicaProvider returns replica from the prepopulated pool (that
  can become empty over time). Released replicas are returned to the pool.

* RoundrobinReplicaProvider returns items from the prepopulated
  list. When the list is exhausted it returns them again thus reusing
  the items. This is usually needed to spread the load between
  fixed number of servers or other cloud resources.

 * CompositeReplicaProvider allows to combine several replica
   providers into one. When new replica is requested it tries to
   obtain it from the underlay providers one by so if the first
   replica provider goes out of resources the second is used
   for further allocations.

 Also refactor replica release interface to better handle
 down-scaling by more than 1 item

Change-Id: I923b2c6d0cd3a881be323399b7b13481e9a4a459

commit_message:
Migration of replication to the template() contract

With introduction of template() contract method
most of the functionality of the replication code
is now built in into murano.

This commit removes unneeded classes, simplifies
replication and fixes bugs from previous commits

Change-Id: I4b2c7c9faa5b0773f2b398e4265f456010766fd9

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-11 16:06:11.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/ipmitool.py', 'releasenotes/notes/ipmitool-bootdev-persistent-uefi-b1181a3c82343c8f.yaml', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_ipmitool.py'], 'message': 'IPMITool: Check the boot mode when setting the boot device

This patch is fixing a problem where the ipmitool option "efiboot"
wasn't passed as part of the command to set the boot device for UEFI
nodes causing them to switch back to legacy BIOS.

A FIXME note was left in the code. It seems that ipmitool has a problem
setting the efiboot + persistent options at the same time
(see bug #1611306). It seems multiple options ought to be specified
together, and that works, except for efiboot. Therefore this patch is
using raw bytes to change the boot device when persistent and uefi are
specified, that way it will work for newer and older versions of the
ipmitool utility.

Closes-Bug: #1611306
Change-Id: I11456fb035fe41fe46f1ff04e4d56c9f85b9e19d
(cherry picked from commit 6419cc2118e9d8c613156f6d4aeae5db46aa385d)
'}]
commit_message:
IPMITool: Check the boot mode when setting the boot device

This patch is fixing a problem where the ipmitool option "efiboot"
wasn't passed as part of the command to set the boot device for UEFI
nodes causing them to switch back to legacy BIOS.

A FIXME note was left in the code. It seems that ipmitool has a problem
setting the efiboot + persistent options at the same time
(see bug #1611306). It seems multiple options ought to be specified
together, and that works, except for efiboot. Therefore this patch is
using raw bytes to change the boot device when persistent and uefi are
specified, that way it will work for newer and older versions of the
ipmitool utility.

Closes-Bug: #1611306
Change-Id: I11456fb035fe41fe46f1ff04e4d56c9f85b9e19d
(cherry picked from commit 6419cc2118e9d8c613156f6d4aeae5db46aa385d)

commit_message:
Move magnum to authtoken

In magnum::keystone::authtoken, use keystone::resource::authtoken
to configure keystone_authtoken section in magnum.conf,
with all parameters required to configure keystonemiddleware.

This patch will allow to deploy Magnum to use Keystone v3
authentification.
Update acceptance and examples

Some deprecations:
- magnum::api::admin_tenant_name is deprecated in favor of
  magnum::keystone::authtoken::project_name.
- magnum::api::admin_user is deprecated in favor of
  magnum::keystone::authtoken::username.
- magnum::api::admin_password is deprecated in favor of
  magnum::keystone::authtoken::password.
- magnum::api::identity_uri is deprecated in favor of
  magnum::keystone::authtoken::auth_url.
- magnum::api::auth_version is deprecated in favor of
  magnum::keystone::authtoken::auth_version
- magnum::api::auth_uri is deprecated in favor of
  magnum::keystone::authtoken::auth_uri

The patch is backward compatible and keep defaults values like before.

Change-Id: I3cf415a1c57e9350ac7bb797ccec2974b497ac44
Closes-Bug: #1604463

commit_message:
remove grenade jobs from horizon

With the removal of tempest tests for horizon, there are no longer any
validation for horizon working after an upgrade in the grenade
tests. We should stop running grenade on horizon. Any upgrade testing
in horizon should come via dedicated efforts in the future.

Change-Id: I2032683f3272188ea2e66a0d27e1f0ac240cf008

commit_message:
Add "Invalid" status to OSSA Task status

"Invalid" should be used when the reported issue is not a bug or
is marked as invalid by the project as it is not a bug/vulnerability.
This is distinct from "Won't Fix" as it indicates there is something
to the report, but nothing for the VMT to do.

Change-Id: I72598c0954a17fd26a4f12513ff28fc2625c374e

subject: only look for v2 objects on upgrade
revisions:

upgrade fails if we upgrade an already upgraded storage because it
grabs split keys and isn't aware of what version to look for. this
patch makes sure upgrade only looks for v2 objects to upgrade and
filters anything else.

Change-Id: Ifb27c845b716a4d0cf9215e78617398ebd09b6e8
Closes-Bug: #1611912
"}]
commit_message:
only look for v2 objects on upgrade

upgrade fails if we upgrade an already upgraded storage because it
grabs split keys and isn't aware of what version to look for. this
patch makes sure upgrade only looks for v2 objects to upgrade and
filters anything else.

Change-Id: Ifb27c845b716a4d0cf9215e78617398ebd09b6e8
Closes-Bug: #1611912

commit_message:
Create puppet-panko repository

Panko provides events functionality to Telemetry. This repo
contains specific configuration files, services, endpoints, etc.

It requires a new Puppet module to be created and be part of
Puppet OpenStack modules.

Source: https://github.com/openstack/panko

Needed-By: Ia20e8534b93a8b295b2f6a07a87754663bd1d868

Change-Id: I4f3a6021eb14480357760d8f8a5d2dd28262b72e

commit_message:
Revert "Configure keystone authtoken options"

This reverts commit eef5b11679e1c0e96a782f51f5e0c8aa6abfb3bd.

Ironic still uses deprecated auth parameters:
https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/common/keystone.py#L95-L98

Revert this revert once ironic uses non-deprecated
auth parameters.

Change-Id: I057ab787578c1a4adbfee1f2bd6d2b61e431450d
Related-bug: #1616873

commit_message:
Move OPT_CONFIG after release env file

By moving the OPT_CONFIG file after the release environment file in
quickstart.sh we allow a user to customize the variables set in the
release file via the --config option.

Change-Id: I18f8609b60c18544580c24862535228ce7eeaddd
Closes-Bug: 1616859

subject: Strongswan: Fix incorrect strongswan auth algorithm sha256 symbol
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-19 01:53:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/functional/strongswan/test_strongswan_driver.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/strongswan_ipsec.py'], 'message': "Strongswan: Fix incorrect strongswan auth algorithm sha256 symbol

The symbol for auth algorithm sha256 is different in openswan/libreswan
and strongswan. For openswan/libreswan it is sha2_256 and for strongswan
it should be sha256. This patch override DIALECT_MAP['sha256'] to 'sha256'
in strongswan device driver.

Closes-Bug: #1614792

Change-Id: I1cfb3e350dfebe266554ead000df1474c87a6e5b
"}]
commit_message:
Strongswan: Fix incorrect strongswan auth algorithm sha256 symbol

The symbol for auth algorithm sha256 is different in openswan/libreswan
and strongswan. For openswan/libreswan it is sha2_256 and for strongswan
it should be sha256. This patch override DIALECT_MAP['sha256'] to 'sha256'
in strongswan device driver.

Closes-Bug: #1614792

Change-Id: I1cfb3e350dfebe266554ead000df1474c87a6e5b

commit_message:

This patch adds the Magnum playbook to the setup-openstack meta
playbook to ensure that Magnum is deployed if the inventory
contains any appropriate hosts.

The release note for the new service has also been adjusted to
be more accurate.

subject: Print remaining tasks on failed upgrade correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-25 09:49:34.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Print remaining tasks on failed upgrade correctly

run-upgrade.sh is designated to re-run from the place
where it failed. Previous behavior is to print entire tasks list
when failures happen. Printing tasks that successfully
completed is not desired. The new update will only show leftover
tasks for the users debugging.

Change-Id: I2e33c43d55696bb91cb40ff590e167546f5f6d18
Closes-Bug:1582272
(cherry picked from commit 619b40c35102964e1a861dd473e7635d2eb7b642)
'}]
commit_message:
Print remaining tasks on failed upgrade correctly

run-upgrade.sh is designated to re-run from the place
where it failed. Previous behavior is to print entire tasks list
when failures happen. Printing tasks that successfully
completed is not desired. The new update will only show leftover
tasks for the users debugging.

Change-Id: I2e33c43d55696bb91cb40ff590e167546f5f6d18
Closes-Bug:1582272
(cherry picked from commit 619b40c35102964e1a861dd473e7635d2eb7b642)

subject: Inject undercloud's CA into python-ironic-agent image
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-15 10:42:33.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/common_functions.sh', 'scripts/deploy.sh'], 'message': "Inject undercloud's CA into python-ironic-agent image

If SSL is enabled, we need the images to trust the undercloud's CA.
This kind of worked since we had a self-signed undercloud image, which
we could cache and it would still work. However, the key should have
changed, so there should have been SSL verification errors.

This behavior changed with the introduction of certmonger. We now
use a CA certificate provided by certmonger, which is local and
specific to the undercloud. With this we can no longer share that
CA, so we need to inject it to the image after it has been generated
(after the undercloud run).

Change-Id: I5bb1c780e21bbc04a24d9fa39350f028e6153306
Closes-Bug: #1613088
"}]
commit_message:
Inject undercloud's CA into python-ironic-agent image

If SSL is enabled, we need the images to trust the undercloud's CA.
This kind of worked since we had a self-signed undercloud image, which
we could cache and it would still work. However, the key should have
changed, so there should have been SSL verification errors.

This behavior changed with the introduction of certmonger. We now
use a CA certificate provided by certmonger, which is local and
specific to the undercloud. With this we can no longer share that
CA, so we need to inject it to the image after it has been generated
(after the undercloud run).

Change-Id: I5bb1c780e21bbc04a24d9fa39350f028e6153306
Closes-Bug: #1613088

commit_message:
Support multiple rabbitmq clusters

The rabbitmq-install play now supports a variable
inventory host group defined with *rabbitmq_host_group*.

This allows deployers to use the play to create multiple
RabbitMQ clusters using for example:

Typical infra cluster:

  openstack-ansible rabbitmq-install.yml

Second cluster for telemetry:

  openstack-ansible -e "rabbitmq_host_group=telemetry_rabbitmq_all" rabbitmq-install.yml

Many vars were moved from group-specific group_vars to the "all" group
as the ceilometer role/play requires the RabbitMQ details and telemetry enabled
state for all services that can potentially be monitored by ceilometer.

By default, the "telemetry cluster" and the "RPC" cluster are the same, but
deployers that wish to create multiple clusters are able to override the
*_rabbitmq_telemetry_* vars when choosing to run separate clusters.

Use case is more fully explained here:

http://trumant.github.io/openstack-ansible-multiple-rabbitmq-clusters.html

Change-Id: I737711085fc0e50c4c5a0ee7c2037927574f8448
Depends-On: Ib23c8829468bbb4ddae67e08a092240f54a6c729
Depends-On: Ifad921525897c5887f6ad6871c6d72c595d79fa6
Depends-On: I7cc5a5dac4299bd3d1bc810ea886f3888abaa2da

commit_message:
Add a tenant ID check to create a bgpvpn resource

Only in the opencontrail driver (as other neutron resource creation)
Improve the opecontrail_client by adding the 'project' resource
Add a function that check the tenant ID by reading (show) the project
Made the check in bgpvpn 'create' and 'update' functions

Change-Id: Iedea7863bed39d9a8f4bff1e2fa647bdd45ba3a5
Closes-Bug: #1604748

It changes the Django configuration switch and the integration test switch.

subject: Fix delete subnet without DHCP enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-23 12:14:39.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovn_api.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix delete subnet without DHCP enabled

When using OVN native DHCP support, deleting a subnet without DHCP
enabled will result in delete_subnet_postcommit failing. Since this
failure is post commit to the neutron DB, the subnet is deleted from
neutron. This patch set fixes delete_subnet_postcommit to handle
subnets without DHCP options.

Change-Id: Icd0fa3025cfa9dd10b6e96d9b485716eb2cf6124
Related-Bug: #1514488
'}]
commit_message:
Fix delete subnet without DHCP enabled

When using OVN native DHCP support, deleting a subnet without DHCP
enabled will result in delete_subnet_postcommit failing. Since this
failure is post commit to the neutron DB, the subnet is deleted from
neutron. This patch set fixes delete_subnet_postcommit to handle
subnets without DHCP options.

Change-Id: Icd0fa3025cfa9dd10b6e96d9b485716eb2cf6124
Related-Bug: #1514488

commit_message:
[zmq] Implement retries for unacknowledged CALLs

This patch tries to implement a mechanism of acknowledgements and
retries via proxy for CALL messages.

Closes-Bug: #1497306
Closes-Bug: #1503295
Depends-On: I83919382262b9f169becd09f5db465a01a0ccb78

commit_message:
Move provision tasks out of nailgun and astute

Provision and deletion tasks shouldn't be hardcoded into nailgun and
astute. This patch creates representation for these tasks in library
side as a separate graphs which can be executed in consecutive manner.

blueprint: graph-concept-extension

Change-Id: Icb55739ad1dbffa3c32341b1caea9046d7917240

commit_message:
Add action check function to senlin plugin

Add check_action_check function to senlin plugin. If action was
successfully executed, return true. If action is still in progress,
return false. If action failed, raise error.

Change-Id: I7ea269aae48ed76d3414b64d40ac3aa0158e27e4

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-23 14:23:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/fake.py', 'nova/tests/fixtures.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'WIP: scheduler functional test framework preview

Scheduler functional test framework is aimed to test the sanity of
scheduler decisions in the quickest way. It should be extensible to test
scheduler features including, but not limited to, image properties, host
aggregates, availability zones, compute capabilities, servergroups,
forced hosts, metrics etc.

This is a preview of this framework providing the feature of setting up
initial resource view, configuring all scheduler related configurations,
and checking the sanity of final decisions.

It is still too early to formalize the design of this functional test.
There will be a spec describing the final design if the prototype is
mature enough to provide all the expected features.

<Patch History>

PatchSet 1: Initialize the preview to setup resource view, configure
scheduler related configurations, and check the sanity of final
decisions.

PatchSet 2: Implemented AopFixture to notify db changes to the main
functional test greenthread, it is critical to ComputeFilter enabling.
And the main functional test thread no longer need to do polling to wait
for db updates.

Change-Id: I9ad0822933321ed7f42ad21b99b2dbe46c8aa2dd
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: scheduler functional test framework preview

Scheduler functional test framework is aimed to test the sanity of
scheduler decisions in the quickest way. It should be extensible to test
scheduler features including, but not limited to, image properties, host
aggregates, availability zones, compute capabilities, servergroups,
forced hosts, metrics etc.

This is a preview of this framework providing the feature of setting up
initial resource view, configuring all scheduler related configurations,
and checking the sanity of final decisions.

It is still too early to formalize the design of this functional test.
There will be a spec describing the final design if the prototype is
mature enough to provide all the expected features.

<Patch History>

PatchSet 1: Initialize the preview to setup resource view, configure
scheduler related configurations, and check the sanity of final
decisions.

PatchSet 2: Implemented AopFixture to notify db changes to the main
functional test greenthread, it is critical to ComputeFilter enabling.
And the main functional test thread no longer need to do polling to wait
for db updates.

Change-Id: I9ad0822933321ed7f42ad21b99b2dbe46c8aa2dd

commit_message:
Add VNC console support for ironic virt driver.

Implements get_vnc_console method for ironic virt driver.
VNC server on baremetal servers requires password authentication.
This change also introduces new optional field for password.

Change-Id: Id58f354f44821f1c98452a6877928279534956cb

As reported in the bug, the quota exceeded error on API level needs

commit_message:
Replaced code error 400 with 403 for over quota

As reported in the bug, the quota exceeded error on API level needs
to be updated to use code 403. This patch simply updates the only
over quota error of nova.api.openstack.compute.tenant_networks which
still uses 400.

Change-Id: Ibc72ba9f1c38cb87787cf0bdee973fd9bce53542
Closes-Bug: #1451991

commit_message:
Check volume status before call detach-volume

check the volume status before nova-compute call detach-volume to cinder-api.
because there are the inconsistent status of a volume between nova and
cinder.

Change-Id: Ib0107dc7cb0dd2e0f4ebf6fe233b08e959a58c35
Closes-bug: #1552265

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-30 09:05:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/security_group/security_group_base.py'], 'message': 'Security group rule create does not accept ip protocol numbers

Currently Security group rule create command is not accepting
"any" or "-1" as a protocol option.

To provide support for "any" as a protocol name, from_port and
to_port need to be updated as "None" in accordance with
novaclient code changes.

Change-Id: I96f768b17ad388f05b101e8fda8e5279cf71de5b
Closes-Bug: #1500455
'}]
commit_message:
Security group rule create does not accept ip protocol numbers

Currently Security group rule create command is not accepting
"any" or "-1" as a protocol option.

To provide support for "any" as a protocol name, from_port and
to_port need to be updated as "None" in accordance with
novaclient code changes.

Change-Id: I96f768b17ad388f05b101e8fda8e5279cf71de5b
Closes-Bug: #1500455

commit_message:
Add inject NMI support to ironic driver.

This patch introduces a new power state "INJECT_NMI" to ironic driver,
and add a new method "inject_nmi" to implement that action.

Change-Id: I840bc31f188051ad4a5e53dbaa14b2b555b37642
Implements: blueprint inject-nmi-ironic
Related-to: blueprint enhance-power-interface-for-soft-reboot-and-nmi
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <chen.tang@easystack.cn>

commit_message:
(WIP)Filter instance query result for DB who doesn't support regex

Some DBs (eg. DB2) do not have build-in regex support. Need to use
python to filter the result set of db query, in order to satisfy
the regex filtering requirement of Nova api.

Co-Authored-By: Man Li Qi <qimanli@cn.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I79b114483de3874905d000f32fb729197f1cfc87
Closes-Bug: 1383325

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-02-29 02:31:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/scheduler.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': '[WIP]Add config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval" for scheduler

In nova-scheduler, we now use
scheduler/host_manager/update_from_compute_node()
to update information about a host from a ComputeNode
object. Currently, the information won't update
if the updated time in scheduler is later than
the updated_at time in compute:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/scheduler/host_manager.py#L162-L164

This is generally correct but as the periodic task
updates information in compute only update the information
when if there are changes:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L659

This may cause inconsistency if the scheduler have
consumed(updated) the information but then the compute
fail to claim (the periodic task won't update because
there are no changes).

This patch adds a config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval".
If the updated time in scheduler is later than
updated_at in compute but the difference bettween the
updated time in scheduler and current time is larger
than this interval, it will still update the information
from compute to avoid inconsistency. The default value
of this config option is set to be 300 seconds for reference.

Doc-impact:

Change-Id: I095c8eb01f6087a73b1dbf2f5500a2a8a674615e
Closes-bug: #1528743
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP]Add config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval" for scheduler

In nova-scheduler, we now use
scheduler/host_manager/update_from_compute_node()
to update information about a host from a ComputeNode
object. Currently, the information won't update
if the updated time in scheduler is later than
the updated_at time in compute:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/scheduler/host_manager.py#L162-L164

This is generally correct but as the periodic task
updates information in compute only update the information
when if there are changes:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/compute/resource_tracker.py#L659

This may cause inconsistency if the scheduler have
consumed(updated) the information but then the compute
fail to claim (the periodic task won't update because
there are no changes).

This patch adds a config option "scheduler_compute_node_update_interval".
If the updated time in scheduler is later than
updated_at in compute but the difference bettween the
updated time in scheduler and current time is larger
than this interval, it will still update the information
from compute to avoid inconsistency. The default value
of this config option is set to be 300 seconds for reference.

Doc-impact:

Change-Id: I095c8eb01f6087a73b1dbf2f5500a2a8a674615e
Closes-bug: #1528743

commit_message:
Fix high severity, high confidence bandit issues

When running `tox -e bandit` a couple high confidence, high severity
issues were reported related to jinja2 autoescaping.  This fix uses
the recommendation from bandit and sets autoescape=True.

This patch does not resolve all of the issues reported out of bandit.
Future patches can address that.

Here's the paste output of the two high severity errors:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/418801/

Change-Id: I4b7094f1bb8ee1bf63d9a76b21ab927d19faa579

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-28 21:20:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cells/messaging.py'], 'message': 'Catch InstanceUpdateConflict when saving Instance at the top cell level

Post I293da6f320dd8f3474ce2a9c907298e1fb348181, a DB instance update where the
instance is not found can raise an InstanceUpdateConflict after 5 retries.

Since we were previously catching NotFound when that case occurred, we now have
to catch InstanceUpdateConflict to prevent the top-level cell to raise those
exceptions which can confuse the operator.

Change-Id: Ia03048b6cd0a68ada5f9f0b836fdc561d0a2fa67
'}]
commit_message:
Catch InstanceUpdateConflict when saving Instance at the top cell level

Post I293da6f320dd8f3474ce2a9c907298e1fb348181, a DB instance update where the
instance is not found can raise an InstanceUpdateConflict after 5 retries.

Since we were previously catching NotFound when that case occurred, we now have
to catch InstanceUpdateConflict to prevent the top-level cell to raise those
exceptions which can confuse the operator.

Change-Id: Ia03048b6cd0a68ada5f9f0b836fdc561d0a2fa67

commit_message:
Trace on nova net-delete for neutron network

Problem is when try to delete a neutron network thorugh nova command, it is not working because it is not implemented.

Steps:
1. create neutron network.
    $ neutron net-create net3
2. delete it:
    $ nova tenant-network-delete net3

ERROR (ClientException): Unexpected API Error. Please report this at http://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/ and attach the Nova API log if possible.
<type 'exceptions.NotImplementedError'> (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-b4bfa5df-bed0-4bbd-ad89-e83e97b5df70)
Implemented delete network for neutronv2 in nova

Implemented delete method in neutronv2 api, by calling neutron client api.

And assumed that disassociate of network is not available in neutron network.

Unit test result:
$ neutron net-create test-net
Created a new network:
+-----------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Field                 | Value                                |
+-----------------------+--------------------------------------+
| admin_state_up        | True                                 |
| id                    | e0ea1569-d099-4a1b-9b85-df6b61ba3ced |
| mtu                   | 0                                    |
| name                  | test-net                             |
| port_security_enabled | True                                 |
| router:external       | False                                |
| shared                | False                                |
| status                | ACTIVE                               |
| subnets               |                                      |
| tenant_id             | 02f6d8b7662a45af9fae48c1df276a6d     |
+-----------------------+--------------------------------------+
$
$ nova net-list
+--------------------------------------+----------+------+
| ID                                   | Label    | CIDR |
+--------------------------------------+----------+------+
| 507cdddb-49a5-4dac-b806-4f56b4dda687 | private  | None |
| d97b27e5-bb93-4f10-8499-1ac67920c707 | uknet2   | None |
| e0b7725c-053b-472d-ab88-b11294cb01eb | public   | None |
| e0ea1569-d099-4a1b-9b85-df6b61ba3ced | test-net | None |
+--------------------------------------+----------+------+
$
$
$ nova tenant-network-delete e0ea1569-d099-4a1b-9b85-df6b61ba3ced
$
$ nova net-list
+--------------------------------------+---------+------+
| ID                                   | Label   | CIDR |

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-13 23:23:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filters/utils.py'], 'message': "Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host should only check provided key

Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host should only check provided key rather than
checking for the entire set for all keys. Doing so does not differentiate
it from the option where key is specified and where it is not. For
example in availability zone filter 'availability_zone' is passed as a key
explicitly whereas in aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter the key is not
specified. In its current state of art, the utility method
aggregate_metadata_get_by_host will scan all keys irrespective a
specific key has been specified or not. If a specific key is provided
all keys must not be scanned.

Change-Id: I806b18ce708cc71f81ea758e98164c5639776833
"}]
commit_message:
Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host should only check provided key

Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host should only check provided key rather than
checking for the entire set for all keys. Doing so does not differentiate
it from the option where key is specified and where it is not. For
example in availability zone filter 'availability_zone' is passed as a key
explicitly whereas in aggregate_instance_extra_specs filter the key is not
specified. In its current state of art, the utility method
aggregate_metadata_get_by_host will scan all keys irrespective a
specific key has been specified or not. If a specific key is provided
all keys must not be scanned.

Change-Id: I806b18ce708cc71f81ea758e98164c5639776833

commit_message:
Enable gnocchi systemd services

Marian Krcmari noticed that on a freshly deployed HA Newton system
gnocchi-metricd and gnocchi-statsd are down. This likely came about when
gnocchi moved to composable roles
(I40a3815923099d00a0f3fc1d88a942784e7c6fb9) and those settings made
sense when it was managed by pacemaker.

Also make sure that all services are disabled when managed via
pacemaker and add manage_service: false for gnocchi-api for pacemaker
which was missing.

Change-Id: If7d681e0fa3e84379ac83c8a55b481369fe2849e

subject: Stop eating up SDaemonError in kill_all and shutdown_all
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-24 15:27:39.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/agent/storlet_daemon_factory/test_daemon_factory.py', 'Engine/agent/storlet_daemon_factory/daemon_factory.py'], 'message': 'Stop eating up SDaemonError in kill_all and shutdown_all

Prevously, we ignore any SDaemonError which happens when
killing/shutdowning all storlet daemons.
This patch makes these functions re-raise SDaemonError, to
enable us to detect the bug situation which causes these
exceptions.

bonus:
This patch also includes fixes about the usage of assertRaises,
and also introcudes assertRaisesRegexp for more clean assertion
about exception messages.

Change-Id: I1af681729ac0a66fd76d0ee3d6e80bc7669566f4
'}]
commit_message:
Stop eating up SDaemonError in kill_all and shutdown_all

Prevously, we ignore any SDaemonError which happens when
killing/shutdowning all storlet daemons.
This patch makes these functions re-raise SDaemonError, to
enable us to detect the bug situation which causes these
exceptions.

bonus:
This patch also includes fixes about the usage of assertRaises,
and also introcudes assertRaisesRegexp for more clean assertion
about exception messages.

Change-Id: I1af681729ac0a66fd76d0ee3d6e80bc7669566f4

commit_message:
Role cleanup/changes for newton OSA

- The database create and user creates have been removed from the
  role. These tasks have been relocated to the playbook.

- Tags cleanup.

- The "Attempt venv download" task now uses the "checksum" parameter
  from the get_url module to check if it is necessary to download
  the venv.

- The playbook and its variables (on extras folder) have been updated
  to reflect these chages.

Change-Id: If15f32d51a4f0265322abbcf25d96ba5c77fe1a6

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-01-11 06:11:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': '[db] Instances named invalid regexp string can't been deleted

Users boot instance with special characters like "vm_(". When try to
show or delete the instance. Query will just pass filter value as regexp
pattern. Therefore users try to find instance with 'vm_(' in db will
raise "Got error 'parentheses not balanced' from regexp". In same case,
if users use 'vm_[' will "got Got error 'brackets ([ ]) not balanced'
from regexp".

These issues were occured when users create instances, which name are
invalid regular expression format. We should escape fitler values which
are invalid regexp string.

Change-Id: I15f5d6c89dbd4cee6c297b2b793d31cc92c178a0
closes-Bug: 1524044
'}]
commit_message:
[db] Instances named invalid regexp string can't been deleted

Users boot instance with special characters like "vm_(". When try to
show or delete the instance. Query will just pass filter value as regexp
pattern. Therefore users try to find instance with 'vm_(' in db will
raise "Got error 'parentheses not balanced' from regexp". In same case,
if users use 'vm_[' will "got Got error 'brackets ([ ]) not balanced'
from regexp".

These issues were occured when users create instances, which name are
invalid regular expression format. We should escape fitler values which
are invalid regexp string.

Change-Id: I15f5d6c89dbd4cee6c297b2b793d31cc92c178a0
closes-Bug: 1524044

commit_message:
Add soft reboot support to ironic driver.

This patch introduces a new power state "SOFT_REBOOT" to ironic driver,
and make reboot() be able to handle soft and hard reboot.

Change-Id: Ibd07ff510ca84db46b685315582dd9ed19726bbb
Implements: blueprint soft-reboot-poweroff
Related-to: blueprint enhance-power-interface-for-soft-reboot-and-nmi
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <chen.tang@easystack.cn>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-11 07:41:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "[libvirt] Attaching volume to paused instance error is not clear

If we try to detaching disk from paused instance, device will still in
use until instance was been unpaused. It is same even we detach disk
with live option. When users try to attach available volume libvirt will
raise exception. Log will only recored with device is in use and device
is buzy. Users will probably felt confuse.

We can specify other device name, but it is not hourned in
libvirt. Maybe we can just notify users when they try to attach disk to
exist device in paused instance. Besides this situation didn't need to
connect volume.

Change-Id: I436149e194713a714701ca4d37138faab67ce6fa
Closes-Bug: 1427732
"}]
commit_message:
[libvirt] Attaching volume to paused instance error is not clear

If we try to detaching disk from paused instance, device will still in
use until instance was been unpaused. It is same even we detach disk
with live option. When users try to attach available volume libvirt will
raise exception. Log will only recored with device is in use and device
is buzy. Users will probably felt confuse.

We can specify other device name, but it is not hourned in
libvirt. Maybe we can just notify users when they try to attach disk to
exist device in paused instance. Besides this situation didn't need to
connect volume.

Change-Id: I436149e194713a714701ca4d37138faab67ce6fa
Closes-Bug: 1427732

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary headers in xen plugin

During image upload in Xen plugin several
useless headers are passed to Glance server.
They can be omitted.

Change-Id: I5836e45965514bf295e49e78f2cfd341b3e1acbb
